reviews.text: A wonderful way to step back in time and spend an afternoon. The exhibits are exceptional and well cared for. It's great that these pieces of history we're saved and preserved. I would have loved to have been able to climb into an engine cockpit but I understand the need for preservation. The rooms with china and silverware were really fun to wander through and let my imagination run. The 'ghost' passengers in the station told a powerful story.

I had my son's fourth birthday here. Birthday parties are held in a train car, which was the absolute coolest. Staff was so friendly, even leading up to the event. It ended up being the best birthday party ever!!!!! My guests were blown away by how cool it was! I took a gamble, as I've never been before, and it did not disappoint. So interactive, entertaining  and informative for both adults and kids. Most importantly my 4 year old was just memorized by everything. I'd give them 100 stars if I could and we will definitely be back soon!

The Galveston Railroad Museum was a great stop on our day trip to the city. The open exhibits were a fascinating trip back in time. I also enjoyed the building with train sets and antique dishes from dining cars. The price is reasonable, the staff was friendly, and it didn't take too long to see the whole museum. It is a great attraction for couples, families, and singles.

Do not let the first impression distract you. Although the train station/entry was nice the real splendor of the museum is outside and in separate buildings. The model train display was very nice. The refurbished dining cars with kitchens were very interesting. Excellent history of railroads across the nation.

Self-guided tour that was as informative as you wanted it to be. It was neat to see all of the different rail cars and systems used. The younger ones enjoyed the models that were working and on display.  Some good information and a good pace.

This place is awesome!  I attended a wedding reception here and it might be the only reception I've attended that the men enjoyed as much as the women!  It easily accommodated entertainment with a classy environment.

Not only does it have lots of airplanes, motors, propellers, etc... It also has great, interactive displays.  And patrons are allowed to get really close to many of the airplanes. 

The staff were very welcoming and helpful.

Great place to spend a couple hours with the whole family. Restrooms are clean with changing tables and there's a snack room with tables and vending machines but I'd suggest packing some sandwiches and snacks from home for meals. The membership pays for itself if you go twice a year, and then you can get a discount at the gift shop as well. The planes, volunteers, and staff are friendly and  knowledgeable. Check out their event calendar for some fun, inexpensive family outings.

The museum has been completely revamped since it's move from Galveston. It looks amazing. Very clean and open exhibits allow you to walk among some of the coolest aircraft you could ever see in person. The rotating exhibits also allow for a different experience every time and the flight academy let's kids 10 and up try flight simulators and even do a flight check in a real plane all at no extra cost. Can't wait to come back.

Wow, what a cool place for plane buffs! Impressive collection of aircraft all presented in immaculate form and setting as this museum is brand new! Awesome addition to the area with NASA just down the highway.

Extremely organized display. I was very impressed with the elegance and amount of material they had on display, such as the historical descriptions to the various types of aircraft in the hangers. The facility was very clean and fancy. The staff were very friendly and many of them are very knowledgeable on the subject matter and were more than happy to teach you more about anything that interested you. Very well worth the money. They even offered a AAA discount so it was $12 per adult. We ended up staying well over 2 hours. Definitely would recommend for anyone! They have educational displays for those that aren't experts in aviation and even interactive displays along with the explanations.

Coolest park I've been to! Right off the water. You can enjoy fishing on the pier or off the rocks and the playground is an arms length away. Very big and tons of space to even play soccer or football. Traveling from Austin and next time we come, we will def be coming here again. In the parking lot you can also pay to tour the USS Stewart and a Navy submarine too!

Great place to bring the family. Lots of really neat things to see. The place is very well kept. There's picnic tables and a really nice park for the kids to play. There's also fishing access along the piers.

I am an Army veteran and visited here while in town with my wife. It is always interesting to see how life was for the other branches of the service back in the old days. So it is very cool to be able to walk around a WWII submarine and warship and see how they lived while on duty. The museum is always in a state of renovation and repair, but that is a good thing as they are working to restore the ships and improve the displays.  It was a very cool way to spend a few hours
It's a great park to visit. Good fishing and scenery. You can also take your time touring a WW11 destroyer and submarine.
Awesome fishing pier. Fun to watch ships come and go. Beautiful park. Parking fee $6.

Very cool historic sailing ship to visit. They now are offering where you can buy a plank to help preserve it. They also sold tickets to take a ride . It’s a very neat piece of history that is anchored to the harbor side of Galveston Island.

This ship is absolutely breathtaking...it is great to see such an old ship being maintained to bring a piece of history to the present. Although it is no longer all wood, you can almost imagine the sounds of the old wood cracking as you walk on board. They are working on offering a long ride out to see on the ELISSA but it is not yet running. It will be an expensive ride somewhere in the hundreds. We went on the Seagull II on a narrated tour of the area and also went in the museum. All of which was a lot of fun!
The museum was kinda bland. Not many exhibits or artifacts. The Elissa itself is actually pretty neat. The tour boat was great, tho. Captain had some great and funny commentary. Do recommend it.
Elissa is a one of a kind place. Not often you get to see a 141 tall ship in action. Come on the right day and you can watch the cree set sails and run through their drills. Amazing!

Great info. To see the ship was great, but the museum was also really neat! Our boys thought it was really cool to be on a pirate ship. Then they realized it was a cargo ship. But they had a good time learning about immigration through Galveston.

Wonderful place with outstanding people. The servers and service are exceptional. If I ever get a vote Nick's is the best burger in Galveston and possibly all of Texas. It's huge and delicious.....cooked just right and served with their crispy fries. Don't miss it.

Great place to hang out and get some fresh seafood.  The shrimp is out of this world, pretty good beer selection too.  I forget what it's called but they have a "loaded" friend shrimp that is really good.  We were with a group of about six, the service was top notch, they took good care of us.  I'll be back next time i,m on the island.

Interestingly, this place is connected to two other restaurants, and they all have a different atmosphere. Nick's is more for us who prefer something less expensive, not too ritzy, and a little rowdy. We had the fried catfish and also the Gulf snapper. While the fried catfish was too dry (thank goodness for the tartar sauce), the snapper was extremely delicious. Also, the waitress forgot to give us silverware and didn't return for about 5 minutes after she gave us our food to bring us some.

Great service tonight and shrimp platter was excellent.  Kudos to manager for getting it together a few minutes after the bell. Excellent shrimp platter again. The older manager seems to be on top of things
We needed a table for 6 and got right in on a Saturday evening.  The food was delicious.  The shrimp was fresh and so good! We also had a great waitress.  Overall, a great place to eat!

While I have only been in Galveston for less than 24 hours. The Mosquito Cafe lived up to its hype. From the time we walked in we were greeted with open arms as if we’ve been friends for years. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. The food is amazing. I had the corned beef hash tacos with a side of eggs. From the first to the last bite you could taste every bit of flavor. Everything was cooked to perfection. Highly recommended this fine establishment.

Beautiful atmosphere! I love the design and plants added. It made my experience home-like. The service was quick and friendly. However, I believe that the food came out too quickly. My corned beef dinner was mildly warm and seemed to have been sitting out for a while. I also paid too much for my meal for what is was worth. The portions were small and my drink (iced tea) cost me 4 dollars. The quality of the tea was high on the contrary. I would recommend this place to my closest family, but not to my close acquaintances.

Great place off the tourist area. Cant speak to the food because i just wanted some coffee and dessert which was wonderful. The sweets are all made by the bakery across the street Pattie Cakes, which is the best! Definitely want to come back for a meal though. Their menu looks amazing.
This place had incredible food! We sat on a beautiful patio and ate our delicious waffles with the sea breeze blowing over us. Highly recommend! Great prices and friendly staff.

This restaurant was a bit pricey, there were only a few empty parking spots to choose from, and there was a decent line when we walked in, but the food was absolutely delicious!! I recommend the pancakes and challah french toast, with the mango juice. I’d definitely come back here again. Plenty of seating inside, but no booths existed, which was disappointing.

The service was great, the food was very delicious. We did not get to enjoy the band, but if we stayed I am sure that would have been great too. After we were done I went to use the restroom.  Wish I hadn't. It was horrible. I always say the bathroom can be a reflection of the kitchen. Please send employees in the restroom more often to clean. The toilets do not flush well, and nasty people have the habit of throwing tissue on the floor. This would have been a 5 star review if not for the restroom.

I am not sure what is more mediocre, the food or the amateur service. Food was clearly sitting around before it got to our table. Other than lack of freshness, flavors were plain. No going back to Yaga’s for sure, consider Taco Bell or Burger King instead, same level food, much cheaper, and much faster.

We LOVE this place! It was our first time here and we will be returning when ever we visit Galveston again. I love the location of this place. We're in spring break right now but it wasn't overly crowded. There was a band playing outside, the weather was cold. We had a great time outside. We got hungry and decided to try this place that was looking towards the plaza with huge windows. Staff is friendly and food is amazing. I love the texture of the fries, crispy and great flavor. My crispy chicken burger was great; big size. Need to open wide to take a bite. One of my daughters asked for a shrimp burger totally thought it was something else. It was delicious, we've never tried polenta before. Wasn't expecting a $11 price, when I saw it I thought it was more expensive. The food is affordable. I hate pink lemonade but the one my kid asked for was great too not to sweet it was actually perfect.

Yaga's is everything you want in a fast served yet laid back environment cafe.. Friendly service from our server, tasty food from the cooks, and a good selection of music to keep you reminded youre on an island. Thank you to Yaga's for having me and my fiance for two delicious burgers!

Good food, good selection, good price... cheapest we fed the family here in Galveston. Bad drinks. Iffy service. I recommend the Rasta pasta,  club sandwich and fried zucchini. I tried the dirty monkey and Bahama mama... I didn't finish either. They looked good but tasted bad.
We enjoyed the food and service! Was not used to Italian sausage in pasta sauce, not my taste. The rest of the food was very good and came out in a timely manner!
A really super experience. I hadn't been there in 20 years. A refreshing trip back to unique family-owned restaurants. Worth your time!

Luigi's is only open for lunch on Friday so we took advantage of the opportunity to change things up. Like a step back in time. An Augusta tradition for many years. A family owned restaurant similar to what you might have found in New York City or Chicago in the 40's.. Features wonderful fresh Greek and Italian cuisine. Great pizza. Greek style chicken and with a quarter you can play music from the music box right at your table. Lunch features either 1/2 order pasta dished or you can order from the full menu. The owner, Penny "Mama" Luigi was out front as usual but she left before we could speak to her. Tired of chain restaurants? Give Luigi's a shot. I promise you'll go back again.

Sorry to do this the a good staff, but the food was not good at all. The best thing was garlic bread.  We had to send back both of our meals.  We ordered chicken parm with Alfredo over pasta and the mashed potatoes with peppers. It was terrible!
Classic Italian/Greek restaurant if there was one. The service was amazing and very accommodating to my friend

Cozy atmosphere. Not busy this evening, which worked out well for us and our children. Food was delicious, even the kids' meals. Great steak, perfectly tender seafood, fantastic sauces. I definitely recommend the Chef Winter's Seafood Combo or the filet (if you're not a seafood lover.) Prompt, friendly service, cold drinks and all in a fun neighborhood.

We were curious and hungry, so we headed there late Saturday night. Arrived a few minutes past 9. Really cool atmosphere, lots of cool interior details like the fish lights over the bar. My wife got bacon wrapped shrimp on grits, I got the ribeye topped with grilled gulf coast shrimp, with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. All cooked to perfection, and bursting with flavor.

Service was impeccable, and we never felt rushed even as closing time approached. Living in Austin, a town that claims to have great eateries I wish the owners of Austin restaurants would come here to learn about true service, presentation, ambience and quality. It would do them well. 

Don't bypass this place on your next visit. It's great food, service, atmosphere and relaxed, all for a reasonable price.

visited this Galveston institution during restaurant week. Service was super fast, but our entrees came out before we had even touched our salads. each of us had a different one of the featured entrees and all were excellent
Awesome experience. Loved the food and the staff. We had salmon,  salad, and gyoza! All 5 star!
Food was phenomenal! Service was great. Always love our experiences when we go.

The service was great, the food was very delicious. We did not get to enjoy the band, but if we stayed I am sure that would have been great too. After we were done I went to use the restroom.  Wish I hadn't. It was horrible. I always say the bathroom can be a reflection of the kitchen. Please send employees in the restroom more often to clean. The toilets do not flush well, and nasty people have the habit of throwing tissue on the floor. This would have been a 5 star review if not for the restroom.

No going back to Yaga’s for sure, consider Taco Bell or Burger King instead, same level food, much cheaper, and much faster.
